text:
<@U01REJKQZ09>

So your goal is to fetch objects using property values, for that i would recommend to go with the search api - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>

for your question about unique properties per object - please scroll down in the above url and find - `Default searchable properties for CRM Objects:`  and you'll find the list of objects and their associated searchable properties.

Thanks <@UCH1L597V> ,will check out the search APIs .

Was looking into Batch read API for Batch operation of reading records in bulk(100 records in a API call) instead of search API call for individual records.
using search api too you will get batch response, please have a look here - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
<@U01E4DUKW12> Maybe oversimplification here but, could it be as simple as giving each one of your support agents a custom url param? <http://mysite.com/?HubSpot_owner_id=9990998>
Hi everyone. Does legacy docs mean those APIs are planned to be deprecated or change in the near future? Specifically the “Get a contact by its user token” one.
Hello, can we store same product with different store in HubSpot api.
means same product sku with different currency price.
legacy code that will be phased but was wondering mostly.
i would go out on a limb and say they werent updated to accommodate as the energy would be focused on the newer apis
well your limb is sturdy its confirmed from HubSpot it doesn’t work on v1.

Is it possible to veto a `contact.privacyDeletion` ? We need to prevent deletion in our system if the contact is a current customer with an ongoing subscription we’ve tried responding with an HTTP error but HubSpot still deletes the contact and retries the deletion on our system again later. At very least we need to communicate the problem the the user.

Thanks again for taking the time to look into my queries.

I might be missing something here, have looked into the search API ,not sure if i can use it for this particular use case:
Example : I have n records with email enail1,email2,....,emailn and i want to query the records with these emails in a single search operation.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search> : operators
I dont see anything like IN operator where we can check records against a list of property values.

Hello team,
please help if it is possible. We have an API with a hook configured having Event throttling set to 1/second.
One colleague changed the internal values for "hs_lead_status" and this action resulted in thousands of requests sent to the hook URL,
generated by 
subscription->contact.propertyChange 
[changeSource] => AUTOMATION_PLATFORM
By requests, I understand the call to the hook URL, each having one event as property change.

Is there anything we can do to?

Thank you
Dan
Thank you Dennis, I really appreciate this advice!

I’m attempting to delete a custom object from my account to start over and am getting a 400 error with the message: ‘Unable to access requested object type’. I’ve done this plenty of times before but am getting this for the first time. I’ve deleted all of the object records so am perplexed what would prevent me from being able to delete the custom object. Any insights would be greatly appreciated!
